alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Henry; Rush; Shelby (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 10:19PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Shelby, southern Hancock, Rush and southwestern Henry Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1019 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Greenfield to 6 miles west of Shelbyville. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Shelbyville and Greenfield around 1030 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Rushville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 97 and 124. Interstate 74 between mile markers 105 and 122. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central and east central Indiana.
